m_DescList: We talked earlier about how to match numbers of length 100, which are, of course:
Adding <color=#FF68DD>{n}</color> after a regular expression indicates the preceding regex should repeat n times, where n is a natural number.
Adding <color=#FF68DD>{n,}</color> after a regular expression indicates the preceding regex should repeat at least n times (n is a natural number).
Adding <color=#FF68DD>{n,m}</color> after a regular expression indicates the preceding regex should repeat between n and m times (both natural numbers).
E.g., <color=#AB2800>o</color><color=#FF68DD>{1,2}</color> matches in <color=#3c3cff>Choose your right friends ooo</color>:
Long time no see, the snake has grown longer!
Now we need to filter snakes with "a" length greater than or equal to 3 and less than or equal to 5.
Don"t pick wrong snakes - they bite!
Please construct a regular expression that passes all test cases on the right.
